emails.subject: URGENT: New SAE Report - Study DNLI-123 - Site 101 (UCLA) - Patient 101-005
emails.body:
Dear Study Team,

Please see the attached Serious Adverse Event (SAE) form for patient 101-005 enrolled in Part B of the DNLI-123 study.

The patient was hospitalized yesterday evening for pneumonia.

Please confirm receipt of this report and let us know the next steps.

Best regards,

Maria Garcia
Clinical Research Coordinator
UCLA Department of Neurology
(310) 555-1234
maria.garcia@med.ucla.edu

emails.subject: Re: URGENT: New SAE Report - Study DNLI-123 - Site 101 (UCLA) - Patient 101-005
emails.body:
Hi Maria,

Thank you for the prompt notification and for sending the initial SAE report. We have received it.

Alex, can you please take the lead on this from the sponsor side? Please acknowledge the report with the site, request the necessary source documents, and confirm the 24-hour reporting timeline has been met with the Denali safety team (cc'd).

Maria, Alex will be in touch with you shortly regarding the next steps.

Best,

Sarah Lee
Project Manager
Syneos Health

role_descriptions: alex.johnson@denalitx.com: Denali Therapeutics (Sponsor), Clinical Research Associate
description: An urgent email thread initiated by a site coordinator at UCLA reporting a Serious Adverse Event (SAE) for a patient in Part B. The patient was hospitalized for pneumonia. The thread involves Alex Johnson acknowledging the report, requesting source documents, and confirming the 24-hour reporting timeline with the Denali safety team.
